clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Clinical Outcome and Alignment of NAVIO Total Knee Arthroplasty and Conventional Total Knee Arthroplasty A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled, Single Blind Study

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to compare the efficacy, safety and costs of the NAVIO™ system with the conventional intramedullary alignment guide for total knee replacement in a clinical setting. The hypothesis is that total knee arthroplasty (TKA) with the use of NAVIO™ is at least as efficient and safe as TKA with the use of conventional intramedullary alignment guiding.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in planned and achieved alignment in degrees based on CT scan pre- and postoperatively (first 52 participants)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks pre-surgery and 6 weeks post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Difference in preoperatively planned and postoperatively achieved alignment of both the femoral and tibial component of the prosthesis in the frontal, sagittal and coronal plane. Deviations (in degrees varus/valgus, flexion extension, and internal/external rotation) from calculated positions (of both components) to bony anatomic landmarks, used by NAVIO to align the prosthesis, will be obtained.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in planned and achieved mechanical axis in degrees based on CT scan pre- and postoperatively (first 52 participants)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks pre-surgery and 6 weeks post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Preoperatively planned and postoperatively achieved mechanical axis of the operated leg. The mechanical axis is defined as the angle between a line from the centre of rotation of the hip to the centre of the femoral component and a line from the centre of the tibial plateau to the centre of the ankle.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in percentage of outliers of alignment on CT scan pre- and postoperatively (first 52 participants)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks pre-surgery and 6 weeks post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of outliers in alignment (defined as > 3 degrees deviation from positions calculated by software) of the femoral and tibial components in frontal, sagittal and transverse plane.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in percentage of outliers of mechanical axis based on CT scan pre- and postoperatively (first 52 participants)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks pre-surgery and 6 weeks post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of outliers (defined as > 3 degrees deviation from neutral) in mechanical axis of the of the operated leg. The mechanical axis is defined as the angle between a line from the centre of rotation of the hip to the centre of the femoral component and a line from the centre of the tibial plateau to the centre of the ankle.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the visual analogue scale scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 24 hours post-surgery, day of discharge, 6 weeks post-surgery, 3 months post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 2 years post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Comparison is made between the two study arms, a higher visual analogue pain score means a worse outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the American Knee Society Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 3 months post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 2 years post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: in a total of 50 points, stability, 25 points, and range of motion, 25 points. The maximum score of 100 points . Comparison is made between the two study arms. A higher American Knee Society Score means a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the Oxford Knee Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 3 months post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 2 years post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Comparison is made between the two study arms, score between 0 and 48. Better score means better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the Lower Extremities Activity scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, day of discharge, 6 weeks post-surgery, 3 months post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 2 years post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Comparison is made between the two study arms, score between 0 and 80. The minimal clinically important difference is 9 scale points. The lower the score the greater the disability.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 3 months post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 2 years post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Comparison is made between the two study arms. Five items for pain (score range 0-20), two for stiffness (score range 0-8), and 17 for functional limitation (score range 0-68). The higher the score, the poorer the function

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in mechanical axis of the prosthesis between the two study arms based on Long-leg X-rays
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 6 weeks post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Post-operative (at 6 week visit) the baseline mechanical axis will be measured as the angle between a line connecting the center of the femoral head with the center of the knee and the line connecting the center of the knee with the center of the ankle.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in positioning of the prosthesis between the two study arms based on Long-leg X-rays
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 6 weeks post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: In order to measure positioning of the prosthesis (coronal alignment), long-leg, weight-bearing, standing anteroposterior and lateral X-rays will be made

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in wear between the two study arms based on Long-leg X-rays
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 weeks preoperative, 6 weeks post-surgery, 1 year post-surgery, 5 years post-surgery, 10 years post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: In the long term, wear can be roughly measured by measuring again the mechanical axis of the leg and comparing this with baseline mechanical axis and by measuring the distance between medial and lateral femoral condyles and medial and lateral tibial platform respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Significant difference in length of hospital stay between the two study arms
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day of discharge from the hospital
primary_outcome.description: Length of hospital stay (in days) will be registered for both groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Operation Time
primary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperative (Time will be recorded from the moment of incision until bandage is being placed)
primary_outcome.description: Compare the duration of surgery between the two study arms

primary_outcome.measure: Significant difference in blood loss between study arms
primary_outcome.time_frame: Intra-operatively until 24 hours post-surgery. .
primary_outcome.description: Blood loss will be measured intra-operatively and up to 24 hours post-operatively. The amount of rinsing liquid will be subtracted from the total amount collected in the suction device to obtain the amount (ml) of intra-operative blood loss. The weight of grids and compresses will be measured post-operatively and dry weight will be subtracted from this value to obtain blood loss not collected in the suction device (1mg = 1ml). On day 2 post-operative, Hb and Ht will obtained.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Complication registration will be done throughout the entire study period

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in frequency of infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 years
primary_outcome.description: When infection is present, this will be noted on the complication registry form and appropriate action will be taken. Distinction will be made between superficial infections and deep infections.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in frequency of trombo-embolic complications
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Attention will be focused on clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in frequency of wound problems
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of surgery until 5 days post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Persistent wound leakage will be registered. Persistent leakage is defined as leakage lasting 5 days after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in frequency of loosening
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 years.
primary_outcome.description: Loosening of tibial or femoral components of the prosthesis as seen on X-ray.

arm_group.description: conventional total knee arthroplasty with standard intramedullary alignment guide

intervention.description: The first 52 participants will recieve a pre- and postoperative CT scan of the hip, knee and ankle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Painful and disabled knee joint resulting from osteoarthritis where one or more compartments are involved, as assessed by X-ray
- High need to obtain pain relief and improve function
- Above 18 years old
- Able and willing to follow instructions
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active infection in knee
- General infection
- Failure of previous joint replacement
- Post-operative or post traumatic malalignment of the knee/leg
- Pregnancy
- Not able or willing to undergo CT-scan
